verses.roman:
nagare hindura dharma bāḍila apāra
'hari' 'hari' dhvani ba-i nāhi śuni āra

synonyms: nagare—in the city; hindura—of the Hindus; dharma—religion; bāḍila—has increased; apāra—unlimitedly; hari hari—of the Lord's name, Hari, Hari; dhvani—the vibration; ba-i—except; nāhi—do not; śuni—we hear; āra—anything else.
translation: " 'The religion of the Hindus has increased unlimitedly. There are always vibrations of "Hari! Hari!" We do not hear anything but this.'
